Sentencas: High operation temperature of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) results in high cell and operation cost, time consuming and fast cell degradation.
Titulo: Millimeter-wave irradiation heating for operation of doped CeO2 electrolyte-supported single solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Developing high performance SOFC that operates at lower temperature is required.
Titulo: Millimeter-wave irradiation heating for operation of doped CeO2 electrolyte-supported single solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Here we demonstrate 24 GHz microwave as a rapid heating source to replace conventional heating method for SOFC operation using 20 mol% Sm doped CeO2 electrolyte-supported single cell.
Titulo: Millimeter-wave irradiation heating for operation of doped CeO2 electrolyte-supported single solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The tested cell shows improvement of 62% in maximum power density at 630 degrees C under microwave heating.
Titulo: Millimeter-wave irradiation heating for operation of doped CeO2 electrolyte-supported single solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This improvement governs by bulk conductivity of the electrolyte.
Titulo: Millimeter-wave irradiation heating for operation of doped CeO2 electrolyte-supported single solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Investigation of ionic transference number reveals that the value is unchanged under microwave irradiation, confirming the charge carrier is dominated by oxygen ion species.
Titulo: Millimeter-wave irradiation heating for operation of doped CeO2 electrolyte-supported single solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This work shows a potential new concept of high performance as well as cost and energy effective SOFC.
Titulo: Millimeter-wave irradiation heating for operation of doped CeO2 electrolyte-supported single solid oxide fuel cell
